stories.text:
It’s possible to create a Microsoft/Outlook account with an existing email (like @gmail.com). Then, if you open Outlook.com, it’s going to autogenerate an email address outlook_*@outlook.com, theoretically designated for sending/receiving emails via Outlook.

Problem is, this email address doesn’t work/exist.

Steps: 1. Create MS account with an existing email: https://signup.live.com/signup 2. Open https://outlook.com 3. Click account (top right corner) > outlook_*@outlook.com a) if you click “My Microsoft account”, it’s going to show a message “That Microsoft account doesn't exist. Enter a different account or get a new one.” b) if you try to send an email to “outlook_**@outlook.com”, it’s going to bounce.

I have a suspicion, it’s not supposed to work like that, can any MS people verify it?
